title: MURDER AT THE CULT: A TRUE-CRIME DOCUMENTARY
description: Inspector Irratino and Deductive Logico took the train upstate to a commune that Irratino had read about in a zine. When they got there, they discovered it was a leaderless society, but only because their supreme leader had just been murdered.

suspects.name: ASSISTANT APPLEGREEN
suspects.description: She dropped out of the publishing game and moved to this commune. Her father is currently not proud.

suspects.name: PHILOLOGIST FLINT
suspects.description: You can learn a lot about a word from its etymology, like where it came from, and have you heard this before?

suspects.name: NUMEROLOGIST NIGHT
suspects.description: A mathematical and esoteric prodigy. Not only do they know the value of E, they know the meaning of E.

weapons.name: A SELENITE WAND
weapons.description: For casting spells and bashing skulls.

weapons.name: A SOUP LADLE
weapons.description: For serving soup at the commune.

weapons.name: A PSEUDO-SCIENTIFIC APPARATUS
weapons.description: Wow, your inner blaxons are really off the chart!

locations.name: THE BARRACKS
locations.description: Where everyone sleeps except their leader. (Their leader never sleeps.)

locations.name: THE LIBRARY
locations.description: More books than you've ever seen. (But all by one guy.)

locations.name: THE ANCIENT RUINS
locations.description: They seem to hypnotize you. You get woozy around them.

clues: The tallest suspect could not have fit in the library: it had low ceilings.
Whoever was in the barracks had green eyes.

statements.speaker: Assistant Applegreen
statements.statement: I did not bring a selenite wand.

statements.speaker: Philologist Flint
statements.statement: A pseudo-scientific apparatus was not by the ancient ruins.

statements.speaker: Numerologist Night
statements.statement: Based on the numbers, I brought a selenite wand.
